data: Status epilepticus is defined as a seizure that lasts for greater than 30 minutes or recurrent seizures without full recovery between seizures for greater than 30 minutes.  A child who has been convulsing for greater than 5 minutes should be treated as for status epilepticus
Refer to Convulsive Status Epilepticus Infants (greater than 2 months) and children
Consider etiology for status epilepticus: trauma, infection, ingestion, drug history, seizure history
Consider empiric meningitic doses of antibiotics and acyclovir for febrile patients without identified etiology
Insert intraosseous needle if failed peripheral IV start after 3 attempts or after 90 seconds and seizure not stopped with buccal / rectal / intramuscular medications
PED ED Peripheral IV and IV Fluids (Module)
5 mL/kg, IV, as directed, administer over 30 minute, drug form: bag
First line therapy (5 to 15 minutes) - No IV Access
Benzodiazepines can be repeated once if seizures persist 5 minutes after initial dose
0.2 mg/kg, buccal, once, drug form: inj, first dose: NOW

First line therapy (5 to 15 minutes) - IV Access Obtained
0.1 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: NOW
0.1 mg/kg, IV, once, PRN: seizure activity, drug form: inj
0.3 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: NOW
0.3 mg/kg, IV, once, PRN: seizure activity, drug form: inj
Second line therapy (15 to 40 minutes) -  IV or IO Access Obtained
Consider IO if no IV access after maximum 3 attempts or after 90 seconds
Avoid choosing a medication that the patient is already on. Unless low levels are suspected then a reduced dose may be given
Select phenytoin OR fosphenytoin OR levETIRAcetam OR phenobarbital OR valproic acid
Avoid valprioc acid for less than 2 years of age and if suspicion of mitochondrial disorder
20 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: NOW

Second line therapy (15 to 40 minutes) -  No or tenuous IV or IO Access
20 mg/kg, IM, once, drug form: inj
10 mg/kg, IM, once, drug form: inj

If seizure has not stopped first and second line therapy consider intubation, consult PICU and Neurology.
Choose a DIFFERENT second line medication once OR start a midazolam bolus then infusion and proceed to PED NEURO Refractory Status Epilepticus Order Set /Protocol
0.1 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: NOW

Volume: 25 ml, Freetxt Rate: titrate, IV, 120 mcg/kg/h starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/h minimum rate, 900 mcg/kg/h maximum rate, titrate instructions:  May increase in 120 mcg/kg/h increments q5min to a maximum of 900 mcg/kg/h
For Infants (<1 year) who fail 2nd Line therapy, consider administering Pyridoxine 100 mg IV
100 mg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: NOW
